message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with communication patterns and protocols in distributed systems, which are typically studied in the Distributed Computing (cs.DC) and Distributed Systems (cs.DS) sub-categories. The focus on self-stabilization suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. The use of message size and information dissemination tasks suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Finally, the use of algorithms and protocols suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category.
